description.plain:
Michael Williams, better known by his stage name Sheff G, is a drill rapper from Brooklyn, New York. He is known for his standout lyrical capabilities compared to the rest of the drill scene, mixing storytelling in with the genre’s signature hardcore style.

Sheff first broke out with his diss track “No Suburban,” directed at fellow Brooklyn rapper 22Gz, in May 2017. He later released his debut mixtape THE UNLUCCY LUCCY KID in September 2019, following up with his second mixtape, One and Only, in May 2020.

songs.full_title: No Suburban, Pt. 2 by Sheff G
songs.title: No Suburban, Pt. 2

description.plain:
“No Suburban, Pt. 2” is Sheff G’s second single from his sophomore studio mixtape One and Only. The track is his second response diss track to fellow Brooklyn rapper 22Gz.

The beef between the two rappers is longstanding. 22Gz released the first track in the series with “Suburban” in December 2016, with Sheff responding in May 2017 with “No Suburban.” 22Gz released his track “Suburban, Pt. 2” in November 2019, almost three years after the original track, leading Sheff to respond with “No Suburban, Pt. 2.”

songs.embed_content: Read “No Suburban, Pt. 2” by Sheff G on Genius

The beef between the two rappers is longstanding. 22Gz released the first track in the series with “Suburban” in December 2016, with Sheff responding in May 2017 with “No Suburban.” 22Gz released his track “Suburban, Pt. 2” in November 2019, almost three years after the original track, leading Sheff to respond with “No Suburban, Pt. 2.”

songs.full_title: Flows, Pt. 2 by Sheff G (Ft. Sleepy Hallow)
songs.title: Flows, Pt. 2

description.plain: Brooklyn’s up-and-coming duo, Flatbush’s Sleepy Hallow and Sheff G reunite for the sequel to their song, Flows. Both reminisce about their past in the streets, coming up and contemplating why they feel so alone in the rap game.

body.plain: Brooklyn’s up-and-coming duo, Flatbush’s Sleepy Hallow and Sheff G reunite for the sequel to their song, Flows. Both reminisce about their past in the streets, coming up and contemplating why they feel so alone in the rap game.

26 ContributorsFlows, Pt. 2 Lyrics[Intro: Sheff G]
Feelin' pressure
I know they feelin' the pressure
I know they feelin' the pressure

I want you around matter of fact no I don’t
